title: Church

adjectives: Relating to or characteristic of Christianity
Of, like or relating to Christianity or Christians.
verbs: To love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; to treat or pursue with devotion or adoration.
To venerate someone or something as an idol.
Love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; venerate as an idol
To make an idol of, or to worship as an idol.
To call upon or pray to earnestly; to entreat.
To ask earnestly for; to seek to obtain by supplication; to entreat for.
To make a request in a humble manner; to call upon in supplication.
To conduct a religious service for (a woman) after childbirth.
Perform a special church rite or service for
nouns: A building, esp. one of large size or imposing appearance.
A structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place
Closed structure with walls and a roof.
Building
A building is a man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place.
Structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory.
A closed structure with walls and a roof.
A building; a structure; an architectural fabric, especially an imposing one; a large or fine building, public or private.
Man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place
A building to which there is free access by the public and which is available for the use of a community.
A place for public (especially Christian) worship
Is a building used for religious activities, particularly Christian worship service
A church building, often simply called a church, is a building used for religious activities, particularly worship services.
House of worship.
A building where Christian religious activities take place.
Religious building for Christian worship
A Christian house of worship; a building where religious services take place.
A dwelling that serves as living quarters for one or more families
Structure intended for living
A structure serving as an abode of human beings.
A human-built dwelling with enclosing walls, a floor, and a roof

A house is a building that functions as a home for humans or other creatures, including simple dwellings ranging from rudimentary huts of nomadic tribes and complex structures composed of many systems.
The abode of a human being, their place of residence.

description: A church building, generally associated with Christian denominations. In addition quiet prayer, churches hold regular worship services, weddings, baptisms and funerals.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the church emoji presents a charming, stylized structure with a gently sloped roof and a prominent steeple, rendered in warm, inviting tones. Its soft, rounded edges and subtle gradients evoke a sense of peace and community, characteristic of Apple's design language. This emoji often symbolizes faith, spirituality, or significant life events like weddings and baptisms, bringing a touch of reverence to digital conversations.
